summary: This is an email from the chambers of Judge Alison J. Nathan to defense counsel in the case United States v. Maxwell (20cr330), transmitting a court order and draft jury selection documents (questionnaire and voir dire) for review prior to public filing.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The Honorable Judge whose chambers sent the email transmitting court documents in the case U.S. v. Maxwell.

persons.name: C Everdell
persons.context: Recipient of the email at CohenGresser.com, presumably part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Recipient of the email from HMF Law, part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Recipient of the email from HMF Law, part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Bc Sternheim
persons.context: Recipient of the email (address appears garbled as bcsternheim_mac.com/bcstemheim@mac.com), part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

Judge Nathan's chambers is communicating court orders and drafts to defense attorney Sternheim.

events.title: Court Issues Order and Jury Selection Drafts
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan's chambers transmits a filed Order and draft jury questionnaire and voir dire documents to defense counsel in U.S. v. Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document is an email from Judge Alison J. Nathan's chambers to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team regarding case 20cr330 (U.S. v. Maxwell).
The email transmits a Court Order and draft jury selection documents (questionnaire and voir dire) for the upcoming trial.
The communication indicates the pre-trial phase is active, with jury selection procedures being finalized in October 2021.
The defense team includes attorneys from multiple firms/law offices: CohenGresser.com, HMF Law, and a private mac.com address.
The Order was to be filed on the public docket shortly after this correspondence.
